question_text: Our Access Dance strategy plans for us to deliver 40 week programming in each of the following cities each year (Fort McMurray, Grande Prarie, Edmonton (Africa Centre), Red Deer, Calgary (Ogden Hub:29), and Medicine Hat). Did we deliver any Access Dance programs to these cities across the province this reporting period?
In which cities?
How long were the each of the programs delivered (weeks)?
List any partners by city if there were any.
How many students did we serve in each city?
What feedback did we receive from participants or partners about our programming? Were there any issues raised?
Do we have plans to deliver the program later this year?
In which cities and when?
Why not?
Are there any cities in our Access Dance strategy that we're not planning to deliver this year?
In which cities and why aren't we delivering this program?
Did we receive any Access Dance specific funding to support this programming this year?
Who were the funding sources and how much did we receive?

Our Access Dance - Rural strategy plans for us to deliver 40 week programming in each of the following rural communities each year (Valleyview, Peace River, High Prairie, Spirit River, Camrose, Ponoka, Rocky Mountain House, Stettler, Olds, Oyen, Foremost, Manyberries, Taber). Did we deliver any Access Dance programs to these cities across the province this reporting period?
In which communities?
How long were the each of the programs delivered (weeks)?
List any partners by community if there were any.
How many students did we serve in each community?
What feedback did we receive from participants or partners about our programming? Were there any issues raised?
Do we have plans to deliver the program later this year?
In which communities and when?
Why not?
Are there any cities in our Access Dance - Rural strategy that we're not planning to deliver this year?
In which cities and why aren't we delivering this program?
Did we receive any Access Dance - Rural specific funding to support this programming this year?
Who were the funding sources and how much did we receive?

Our Powwow & Ballet strategy plans for us to deliver 6 week programming in each of the following cities each year (High Level, Fort McMurray, Fort McKay, Cold Lake, Grande Prarie, Edmonton, Red Deer, Calgary, Lethbridge, and Medicine Hat). Did we deliver any Powwow & Ballet programs to these cities across the province this reporting period?
In which cities?
Other than ISCA, list any other partners in those cities if there were any.
How many students did we serve in each city?
What feedback did we receive from participants or partners about Powwow & Ballet? Were there any issues raised?
Do we have plans to deliver the program later this year?
In which cities and when?
Why not?
Are there any cities in our Powwow & Ballet strategy that we're not planning to deliver this year?
In which cities and why aren't we delivering this program?
Did we receive any Powwow & Ballet specific funding to support this programming this year?
Who were the funding sources and how much did we receive?

Our Newcomers Programming strategy plans for us to deliver 40 week programming in each of the following cities each year (Fort McMurray, Edmonton (Action for Healthy Communities), Calgary (Centre for Newcomers and Canadian Immigrant Women's Association), and Medicine Hat (Saamis Immigration)). Did we deliver any Newcomers Programming to these communities across the province this reporting period?
In which cities?
How long were the each of the programs delivered (weeks)?
List any partners by city if there were any.
How many students did we serve in each city?
What feedback did we receive from participants or partners about our programming? Were there any issues raised?
Do we have plans to deliver the program later this year?
In which cities and when?
Why not?
Are there any cities in our Newcomers Programming strategy that we're not planning to deliver this year?
In which cities and why aren't we delivering this program?
Did we receive any Newcomers Programming specific funding to support this programming this year?
Who were the funding sources and how much did we receive?
Did we provide any free or sponsor-paid tickets to community members or groups this reporting period?
If yes, approximately how many tickets did we provide and to which community groups or partners?
If yes, what outcomes did you observe (new audiences, deeper relationships, repeat attendance)?
If not, what funding, partnership, or operational barriers are limiting free or sponsor-paid tickets?
Did we perform anywhere throughout the province this reporting period (community performances, pop-ups, or tours)?
If yes, where did we perform, what was the context, and approximately how many people attended each location?
How did we use these performances to build relationships, promote programs, or increase access to tickets and classes?
If not, were there provincial opportunities we considered but could not pursue this period?

strategic_pillar: Boost Enrollment & Engagement in AB Classes
question_text: Did we launch targeted marketing campaigns for Alberta Ballet recreational classes this reporting period?

strategic_pillar: Boost Enrollment & Engagement in AB Classes
question_text: If yes, which campaigns did we run (channels, audiences, key messages)?

strategic_pillar: Boost Enrollment & Engagement in AB Classes
question_text: What measurable results did these campaigns generate (inquiries, website visits, registrations, engagement)?

strategic_pillar: Boost Enrollment & Engagement in AB Classes
question_text: If not, what prevented us from running targeted campaigns this period (budget, timing, capacity, creative)?

question_text: Did we see growth in new or returning students in Alberta Ballet recreational classes this reporting period compared to a typical month?
